instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .
definitions.BKLT_EN_R: What is BKLT_EN_R? This signal enables backlight. Anytime you see a signal ending with “_EN” , that means this signal being present/high enables what it is referring to. This signal says “BKL” before “_EN”. “BKL” sounds short for “BACKLIGHT”, so it is safe to assume this signal enables backlight when present. The “_R” suffix means that the signal is asserted when it is high, as in 3.3v, which is the opposite of the “_L”  suffix.
definitions.LCDBKLT_EN_L: What is LCDBKLT_EN_L? This signal enables the backlight when it is low.  _L means the signal asserts itself when the voltage is low. This signal needs to be low to enable backlight. .
definitions.EDP_BKLT_EN: What is EDP_BKLT_EN? This is an enable signal. Anytime you see “_EN”, it means when the voltage is high(3.3 volts), whatever it is going to is being turned on or enabled. Here, “EDP_BKLT” which stands for “embedded displayport backlight” is being enabled. This signal usually goes to an LED driver used for creating a power rail for the LCD screen backlight, to tell it to turn on & create this rail. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A No Backlight
threads.message:
Hello everybody;

I m working on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> (Retina 13" 2015) no backlight problem, No liquid damage or drop. Tried another known good LCD and data cable.

- F7700 = ok and 12.5V
- Replaced <CHIP>U7700</CHIP> nothing change
- <SIGNAL>BKLT_EN_R</SIGNAL> = 3.3V
- <SIGNAL>PPVIN_S0W_LCDBKLT_R</SIGNAL> 12.5V ok
- <SIGNAL>LCDBKLT_EN_L</SIGNAL> is 12.5V ( it must be low i think)
- <SIGNAL>PPVIN_S0SW</SIGNAL>-LCDBKLT is 0v
- <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> = 3.32V

where can i check next step?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A No Backlight
threads.message: Are you absolutely sure you have an image on the LCD?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A No Backlight
threads.message: Yes Duke. When i put the light behind lcd i can see image.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A No Backlight
threads.message: Check data lines continuity from LCD connector pin 3 and 4 to <CHIP>U7700</CHIP>. Check voltage on pin 8 on LCD connector.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A No Backlight
threads.message:
Hi Duke,

LCD pin 3 and 4 shows 5V; LCD pin 8 is 0v; <SIGNAL>EDP_BKLT_EN</SIGNAL> is 3.3V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A No Backlight
threads.message: Read my question again and post your findings.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A No Backlight
threads.message: When checked dataline pin 3 and 4 connecting to <CHIP>U7700</CHIP> without problem.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A No Backlight
threads.message: Are you sure you checked with a known good panel from a 2015+ model? Anything else does not work.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A No Backlight
threads.message:
I dont have full case.. but i have 2015 13" LCD and old models LCD data cable its same problem no backlight :(
Can i put DC to DC converter like this ( [url]http://www.aliexpress.com/item/1pc-Module-4-75V-24V-to-0-92V-15V-DC-DC-Power-Supply-Buck-Converter-Step/32582253910.html[/url] ) and inject backlight voltage directly?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A No Backlight
threads.message: So you are using a 2013 LCD cable.......yeah I'm not sure that will work, actually I'm pretty sure they are different, look at the pinout between the boards. Stop messing around and get proper test parts.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A No Backlight
